One thing I would add about a line in a ".seeds" file like:

+http://www.domain.com/some/path/to/page.html

The '+' means it's only a scoping directive. It gets reported via the 
method nonseedLine() to any SurtPrefixedDecideRule that is listening to 
seed-source events for guidance. And the '+' means it will only be 
noticed by such rules that are also set to ACCEPT. From previous 
messages, I don't think your broad crawl has any such rule.

With the leading '+', that URL will *not* be added as a seed and 
fetched. To add it as a seed, just have the naked URL with no '+'.

- Gordon

On 1/31/12 5:19 PM, travis@... wrote:
> On Tue, January 31, 2012 4:10 pm, David Pane wrote:
>> We are considering a separate crawler to crawl these seeds. We are
>> considering making the crawl very focused (seeds only or maybe a small
>> number of hops out from the seeds).
>>
>> Can Heritrix be configured to pause when it runs out of URIs to crawl
>> instead of finishing?
>
> Yes you're looking for runWhileEmpty on the CrawlController
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Release+Notes+-+Heritrix+3.1.0#ReleaseNotes-Heritrix3.1.0-CrawlControllerpauseAtEndoptionreplacedwithrunWhileEmpty%28HER1776%29
>
> (shorter: http://tinyurl.com/6omzn78 )
>
>>
>> If adding additional seeds via the action directory, can Heritrix be
>> configured to automatically begin crawling if in this paused state?
>
> runWhileEmpty will keep Heritrix running, but not in a paused state. If it is
> paused it will not crawl. If it is not paused, added seeds will be crawled.
>
>>
>> Can an update.seeds file placed in the action directory have the format
>>
>> +http://www.domain.com/some/path/to/page.html
>
> This will work. Heritrix will convert it to surt format the same as if you
> were using seedsAsSurts. However, the given example would be a very
> restrictive surt.
>
> Travis
